userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Humphrey Harwood Account Book, Manuscript MS 33.1, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

altformavail.head: Alternative Form
altformavail.p: Also available on microfilm (M-50) and as photocopies (PH/02/04 and PH/02/05)

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Humphrey Harwood (d. 1788), was a brickmaker and builder in Williamsburg, Va., who worked for many residents of Williamsburg and its vicinity and on most of the public buildings of the town.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Account book of Humphrey Harwood (d. 1788). Ledgers C and D contain the accounts of Harwood's estate, which were settled by his son, William (1768-1794), and by an unidentified person. Among people for whom Harwood worked were John Ambler, James Anderson, Samuel Beall, John Blair, Lewis Burwell, Nathaniel Burwell, William Byrd III, James Carter, Dr. William Carter, Richard Charlton, John Coke, Jesse Cole, Alexander Craig, John M. Galt I, Robert Greenhow, Mrs. Hallam, Mrs. Margaret Hunter, Philip Moody, Mary Stith, Richard Taliaferro, John Travis, St. George Tucker, Benjamin Waller, Thomas Wharton, and George Wythe.

descgrp.head: Adjunct Descriptive Data
descgrp.p: A name index has been created for the account book.
